English:
Hey, knock it off with the gloomy expression.
It's not like you.
Chinese:
喂，別一臉憂鬱啦。
不像妳啊。
Korean:
…야, 우울한 얼굴 하지 말라고
너답지 않다고
German:
Jetzt hör doch auf, Trübsal zu blasen.
Das passt gar nicht zu dir.

English:
It's really me. Is that the face you want to pull?
What would [p] think?
Chinese:
不過，其實就連我也想擺出那種表情啊。
但不知道會被[p]說些什麼呢。
Korean:
그보다, 사실은 나도 그런 얼굴을 하고 싶다고
하지만, [p]에게 무슨 말을 들을지, 하고 말이야
German:
Was würde denn [p] davon halten,
wie du gerade dreinschaust?

English: I get it, I really do, but...
Chinese: 我知道……雖然我知道……
Korean: 알고 있어… 알고 있지만…!
German: Du hast ja recht, aber ...

English: Please, come home!
Chinese: 喂，拜託……回來吧！
Korean: …저기, 부탁이야… 돌아와 줘…!
German: Bitte komm zurück nach Hause!

English: Don't worry! We haven't seen the last of [p].
Chinese: 別擔心啦，他一定會回來的。
Korean: 걱정하지 마, 반드시 돌아올 거라고!
German: Keine Sorge! [p] sehen wir bestimmt wieder.

English:
According to the doctor, all vital signs are
looking great. [p]'s gonna be fine, I promise!
Chinese:
根據醫生的說法，他的身體好像很健康呀……
一定沒問題的，這傢伙一定沒問題！
Korean:
의사의 얘기로는, 몸은 건강하다고 하니까…
분명 괜찮을 거야, 이 녀석이라면, 분명!
German:
Die Ärzte sagen, dass alle Parameter im grünen
Bereich liegen. [p] wird schon wieder!
Versprochen!

English: Yeah.
German: Ja.

English:
Don't be an idiot! What, you think [p]'s
wandering around EDEN like a ghost somewhere?
Chinese:
哎，這傢伙是個笨蛋，
所以應該是在EDEN的某處，當個幽靈四處快活之類的？
Korean:
그 뭐냐, 이 녀석 바보니까
EDEN의 어딘가에서 유령으로 지내면서 들떠 있다던가?
German:
Sei nicht dumm! Denkst du etwa,
[p] spukt in EDEN herum wie ein Geist?

English: Like a certain someone we know?
Chinese: 就像某人。
Korean: …어디의 누구처럼
German: Wie wir es von bestimmten anderen Leuten kennen?

English: Haha, ha.
Chinese: 哈哈、哈……
Korean: 하하, 하…
German: Haha, ha.

English:
That was a subconscious manifestation of my brother while trapped by the Eaters.
It was all outside of his control.
Chinese:
那是因為哥哥的潛在意識被侵食者囚禁，
完全是不可抗力。
Korean:
…그건, 이터에게 사로잡혀 있었던 오빠의 잠재의식의 발현으로,
완전히 불가항력이에요
German:
Das war das Unterbewusstsein meines Bruders, das
sich manifestiert hat, während er in den
Verschlingern gefangen war.

English:
We're the ones who were responsible for all this
happening. Blaming my brother for it is wrong.
Chinese:
而且，當初的起因本來就是我們，
你怪罪哥哥是弄錯對象了。
Korean:
그리고, 애초에 원인은 저희들에게 있었던 거니까
오빠에게 뭐라 하는 건 번지수를 잘못 찾으신 거예요
German:
Wir waren für all das verantwortlich.
Wir dürfen nicht einfach meinem Bruder die Schuld
geben.

English:
It's not like he was doing it all for fun. He
deserves to have the record set straight, along
with an apology.
Chinese:
而且……哥哥什麼時候快活了？
這已經是可以要求訂正和謝罪的中傷行為了。
Korean:
그보다… 언제, 오빠가 들떠 있었단 거죠?
정정과 사죄를 요구해도 되는 레벨의 유언비어예요
German:
Er hat das ja nicht zum Spaß gemacht.
So viel müssen wir ihm schon lassen, und eine
Entschuldigung hat er auch verdient.

English: Whoa. Why so serious all of a sudden?
Chinese: 哇，她當真了……
Korean: 우와, 진지하게 나왔는데…
German: He. Warum bist du denn plötzlich so ernst?

English: What?
Chinese: 什麼？
German: Was?

English: Now, now...
Chinese: 哎呀，好了好了……
Korean: 지, 진정해…
German: Na, na ...

English: Oh, yeah, that's right!
Chinese: 哎，這樣啊……對呀！
Korean: 뭐, 그렇구나…… 그러네!
German: Ach, stimmt ja!

English: It's as Arata the self-proclaimed non-geek says!
Chinese: 或許就像自稱非宅男的新所說的！
Korean: 자칭 오타쿠가 아닌 아라타 군의 말대로! 일지도!
German: Der selbsterklärte Nicht-Geek Arata hat recht!

English: Huh?
Chinese: 什麼！？
German: Was?

English: Are you gonna gang up on my brother too, Nokia?
Chinese: 連、連諾奇雅都打算把哥哥當作廢物嗎？
Korean: 노, 노키아 씨까지, 오빠를 바보 취급 하시는 거예요!?
German: Hast du es auch auf mein Bruder abgesehen, Nokia?

English: Hey, where are you going?
Chinese: 喂、喂，妳要去哪裡！？
Korean: 야, 야, 어디 가!?
German: He, wo gehst du denn hin?

English: EDEN! I'm gonna go on a little search!
Chinese: 「EDEN」！我要去找他！
Korean: 「EDEN」! 찾으러 가려고!
German: EDEN! Ich gehe auf die Suche!

English:
If I just sit there moping and doing nothing,
Agumon and Gabumon will laugh at me!
Chinese:
什麼都不做，只會悶悶不樂，
可是會被亞古獸和加布獸笑的呀！
Korean:
아~무것도 안 하고 끙끙 앓았다간
아구몬이나 파피몬이 비웃을 테니까!
German:
Wenn ich nur traurig hier sitze und nichts tue,
lachen Agumon und Gabumon mich aus!

English: Nokia...
Chinese: 諾奇雅小姐……
Korean: 노키아 씨…
German: Nokia ...

English:
If there's a ghost, maybe there's someone who's
seen it!
Chinese: 而且如果他是幽靈，或許會有目擊證言之類的！
Korean: 유령으로 지내고 있으면, 목격담 같은 게 있을지도 모르니까!
German:
Wenn ein Geist unterwegs ist, dann hat ihn
vielleicht auch jemand gesehen!

English:
And if I search EDEN, I just might find some data
fragments here and there!
Chinese:
找遍EDEN，
或許至少能找到掉在地上的資料碎片之類的！
Korean:
EDEN을 뒤져 보면, 데이터의 조각 정도는
떨어져 있을지도 모르니까!
German:
Und wenn ich in EDEN suche, finde ich
vielleicht hier und da ein Datenfragment!

English:
Whoa... Did I hit full-on cyber sleuth mode just
now?
Chinese: 咦？我現在是不是很像電腦偵探！？
Korean: …어? 나 지금, 전뇌탐정 같지 않아!?
German:
He ... Habe ich jetzt ganz in den
Cyber-Detektiv-Modus gewechselt?

English:
Okay, it's time to gather information!
Come with me, assistant boy!
Chinese:
那麼，開始打聽！
跟我來吧，那邊的沒用哥助手！
Korean:
그럼, 탐문 조사 개시!!
따라 오도록, 거기 있는 잘생기기만 한 조수!!
German:
Gut, Zeit, Informationen zu sammeln!
Komm mit, Helferlein!

English: What? Assistant? Me?
Chinese: 什麼！？助、助手……我是助手！？
Korean: 하아!? 조, 조수… 내가!?
German: Wie? Helferlein? Ich?

English: Ugh! Fine. I guess I'll hang with you, then.
Chinese: 呿，沒辦法……我就陪陪妳吧。
Korean: 칫, 어쩔 수 없구만… 어울려 줄까
German: Hmpf. Na schön. Dann hänge ich halt mit dir rum.

English:
But let's be clear on one thing...
I'm the cyber sleuth, and you're the assistant!
Chinese:
不過啊，先說清楚……
我才是電腦偵探，妳是助手！
Korean:
하지만 말이야, 확실히 말해 두겠어…
내가 전뇌탐정이고, 네가 조수라고?
German:
Aber dass eins klar ist!
Ich bin der Cyber-Detektiv und du bist das
Helferlein!

English:
That's non-negotiable. Hey! Are you even 
listening?
Chinese: 只有這個，我是不會讓步的……喂！聽我說啦！
Korean: 이것만큼은 양보할 수 없어―… 야!? 좀 들어라!?
German:
Nur, dass das klar ist. He! Hörst du mir
überhaupt zu?
